result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Milton Evon Austin Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Milton Evon Austin Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Milton Evon Austin Jr.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference. Court advised of pending negotiations.  Court sets this for projected guilty plea and sentencing date.  Parties are ordered to appear in person. Case adjourned to Br. 9.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-20-2022, filed.

Defendant Milton Evon Austin Jr in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Milton Evon Austin Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State. Defense has submitted counteroffer to the State and State requests additional time to review. Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter for Status Conference. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-5-2022, filed.

Defendant Milton Evon Austin Jr in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Milton Evon Austin Jr.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pretrial Conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests adjourned Status Conference to allow time for additional negotiations.  Request granted.  Defense given approval to appear via zoom. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-26-2022, filed.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection.  Received and Filed.  nk

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Defendant Milton Evon Austin in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 07/08/2022 as the deadline for the State to turnover all discovery with the exception of crime lab reports to defense. Court sets 08/29/2022 as the deadline for filing any motions or change of plea forms. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse. Case is adjourned.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Milton Evon Austin in court, appear in person with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-16-2022

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Austin is in trial in Br. 40; unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SPD Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-5-2022, Filed.

Defendant Milton Evon Austin in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD to appoint Attorney Lamke pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-3-2022

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report dated 2-25-2022; Received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Milton Evon Austin in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Milton Evon Austin in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Milton Evon Austin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
